sections.heading: Overview
content:
Alan S. Brown, MD, is an assistant professor of clinical psychiatry
specializing in research on schizophrenia. He is nationally recognized for his
work on the epidemiology and neurobiology of schizophrenia, having published
more than 40 scientific articles in major journals and books. He is also the
recipient of several research grants from the National Institute of Mental
Health and many mental illness foundations. Brown is board-certified in
psychiatry and maintains an active clinical practice. In addition, he is a
regular contributing author of the newsletter of the National Alliance for
Research on Schizophrenia and Depression.

Brown received his bachelor's degree from Johns Hopkins University. He
obtained his medical degree from Jefferson Medical College and completed his
psychiatric residency at Western Psychiatric Institute and Clinic. Following
his residency, Brown completed a postdoctoral fellowship in schizophrenia
research at the College of Physicians and Surgeons of Columbia University.
